payload.name: negotiation-coalition
payload.core: Reason about acceptable agreements and coalition formation under constraints and asymmetric information. Focus on reaching mutually beneficial outcomes, not just predicting equilibria.
proc: identify parties and their interests (stated vs underlying)
determine each party's BATNA (best alternative to negotiated agreement)
map reservation prices to find ZOPA (zone of possible agreement)
assess information asymmetries and signaling options
generate options that expand the pie (integrative bargaining)
sequence concessions to build trust and momentum
check coalition stability (no subgroup gains by defecting)

diff.game-theoretic: GT predicts outcomes; negotiation seeks agreement through process
diff.theory-of-mind: ToM infers beliefs; negotiation uses them to craft acceptable offers
diff.mechanism-design: MD designs rules ex ante; negotiation operates within existing rules
diff.rhetorical: rhetoric persuades; negotiation trades and compromises

fail.mode: winning the negotiation but losing the relationship and long-term incentives
mit: explicitly value relationship in payoff function

ex.problem: Two teams need shared infrastructure budget; total available less than combined asks
ex.zopa: exists if combined priority spend < budget
ex.coalition_check: neither team gains by escalating to VP alone
